definition: to just happen to coincide with
to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue
see 李适[Li3 Kuo4]
surname Shi
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to just happen to coincide with the occasion (idiom)/to be present just at the right time

sentences.english: The formation of this fifth Committee cannot come at a better time.
sentences.chinese: 本届委员会的成立适逢其时。

sentences.english: So let me start by offering my congratulations to Harvard University as you celebrate your 375th anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 今年适逢哈佛大学建校375周年，在此先恭喜各位。

sentences.english: Yet all this comes even as military-to-military relations are improving.
sentences.chinese: 然而所有这一切适逢军事对军事关系改善之时。

sentences.english: Pittsburgh was a perfect venue for this work.
sentences.chinese: 在这方面，以匹兹堡作为会议地点适逢其会。

sentences.english: The latest round of the eurozone crisis could not have come at a better time.
sentences.chinese: 最近一轮的欧元区危机适逢其时。

sentences.english: As the Mid-Autumn festival, invited the moon a totally.
sentences.chinese: 适逢中秋佳节，遥邀明月共赏。

sentences.english: Talking about heritage, Hong Kong Customs will celebrate its centenary this year.
sentences.chinese: 谈及历史和传统，今年适逢香港海关成立一百周年。

sentences.english: It is so happened that today is also a traditional festival in China, that is Mid-Autumn Day.
sentences.chinese: 今天又适逢中国传统节日中秋节。

sentences.english: This year, the summer solstice falls on a weekend -- this Sunday. Father's Day.
sentences.chinese: 今年，夏至适逢周末，本星期日又是父亲节。

sentences.english: 2007 marks Hong Kong's first decade of reunification with China.
sentences.chinese: 2007年，适逢香港回归祖国十周年。

definition: just at that time/as it happens/by good luck, just then
just at the time of/honest/upright/(math.) positive value
to chance upon/to coincide fortuitously with sth
on this (occasion)/at this time when .../on this occasion
during/at the time of
eve/the day before
every time/on each occasion/whenever
to be about to arrive/to be around the corner
on the happy occasion of
the eve/the night before
day after day/for several days running
to keep up with/to catch up with/to overtake/to chance upon/in time for
end of the year
festive day/holiday
